titleStmt.title: James F. Robinson to John W. Finnell
CWG13739

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; 1863 Office Expenses - Telegraph, Stationary - Transportation - Ordinance Stores; Bundle 6

body.p: As far as I know it seems to me that the public interest will be promoted by letting Colo Alexander work with Colo Riley -- They will then look a company of men of full number now if there are broken fragments to fill up that Regiment at once & then go complete into service & work it ought to be done. We must look to the public interest as the paramount consideration

Robinson J. F.
Gov. Ky.
Conc'g Col. Alexander
J. F. Robinson
